H0.text: In which decade did the Montgolfier Brothers launch the first successful manned ascent in a hot air balloon. 1760s

H1.text: In which decade did the Montgolfier Brothers launch the first successful manned ascent in a hot air balloon. 1770s

H2.text: In which decade did the Montgolfier Brothers launch the first successful manned ascent in a hot air balloon. 1790s

H3.text: In which decade did the Montgolfier Brothers launch the first successful manned ascent in a hot air balloon. 1780s

A4.text: On 4 June 1783, they flew the balloon at Annonay in front of a group of dignitaries from the états particuliers. The flight covered 2 km (1.2 mi), lasted 10 minutes, and had an estimated altitude of 1,600–2,000 m (5,200–6,600 ft).

A5.text: They invented the Montgolfière-style hot air balloon, globe aérostatique, which launched the first confirmed piloted ascent by humans in 1783, carrying Jacques-Étienne.
